question: Your ball has come to rest near a stone, and you can't move the stone without moving the ball. You don't want to risk damaging your club. What are your options?*

choices.text: Play the ball as it lies with no penalty.
You can move the stone and if the ball moves simply put it back where it was without penalty.

explanation: You can ALWAYS declare a ball unplayable on a course as long as it is not in a penalty area.
